what.title: What is UTM?
what.content: UTM (Urchin Tracking Module) parameters are URL parameters used to track the effectiveness of digital marketing campaigns. They allow analytics tools like Google Analytics to accurately identify traffic sources.

why.title: Why Use UTM Tags
reasons: Track traffic sources: Accurately identify where visitors come from
Measure marketing effectiveness: Track the performance of each campaign
Optimize budget: Focus investment on effective channels
Data-driven decisions: Build marketing strategies based on accurate data

traffic.title: Accurately Track Traffic Sources
traffic.description: Determine exactly which websites, campaigns, or channels are driving traffic to your site.

measurement.title: Precisely Measure Marketing Effectiveness
measurement.description: Evaluate the performance of each marketing activity and identify the most effective strategies.

optimization.title: Optimize Marketing Budget
optimization.description: Invest more in high-performing channels and cut back on less effective ones.

dataDriven.title: Data-Driven Marketing Decisions
dataDriven.description: Make informed decisions based on accurate data, rather than guesswork.

marketing.title: Measure Marketing Effectiveness
marketing.description: Accurately measure and analyze the performance of your marketing campaigns.

data.title: Base Decisions on Accurate Data
data.description: Make informed decisions based on reliable data and analytics.

budget.title: Optimize Marketing Budget
budget.description: Allocate your marketing budget effectively by focusing on the most profitable channels.

bestPractices.title: Best Practices
tips: Use underscores (_) instead of special characters

Custom thumbnails for social media sharing

Choose resolution that matches your branding

head.title: YouTube Timestamp URL Generator Guide - Marketing Tools

youtubeTimeGuide.title: YouTube Timestamp URL Generator Guide
youtubeTimeGuide.description: Learn step-by-step how to create and use timestamp URLs that take you directly to a specific time in a YouTube video.

what.title: What is a YouTube Timestamp URL?
what.content: A YouTube timestamp URL is a URL that starts playing a video from a specific point in time. It's useful for improving user experience and highlighting key content by allowing viewers to quickly jump to the part they want to watch.

card1.title: Viewer Convenience
card1.content: Quickly find and watch the desired part in a long video

card2.title: Highlight Key Points
card2.content: Emphasize specific parts to enhance message delivery

how.title: How to Use the Timestamp URL Generator
how.content: Follow these simple steps to create and use a YouTube timestamp URL.

step1.title: Enter YouTube URL
step1.content: Copy the URL of the desired YouTube video and paste it into the input field.

step2.title: Set Time
step2.content: Enter the time (hours, minutes, seconds) at which you want the video to start.

step3.title: Generate URL
step3.content: Click the 'Generate Timestamp URL' button to create the timestamp URL.

example.title: Example
example.description: A timestamp URL that starts at 1 minute and 23 seconds looks like this: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=VIDEO_ID&t=1m23s

tip1.title: Set Time Accurately
tip1.content: Enter the hours, minutes, and seconds accurately to start playback from the desired point.

tip2.title: Share URL
tip2.content: Copy the generated timestamp URL and share it on blogs, social media, emails, and other channels.

byteStandard.title: Byte Calculation Standard
byteStandard.korean: Korean: 2 or 3 bytes depending on encoding

encoding.title: Korean Bytes by Encoding
encoding.utf8: UTF-8: 3 bytes (Variable length encoding for efficient Unicode processing)
encoding.utf16: UTF-16: 2 bytes (Processes all Unicode characters as 2 bytes)

platform.title: Platform Standards
platform.google: Google/Facebook Ads: Character count only (bytes irrelevant)

roas.title: ROAS Analysis
roas.description: ROAS (Return On Ad Spend) shows the ratio of revenue to advertising cost. For example, ROAS of 500% means $5 in revenue for every $1 spent on advertising.

efficiency.title: Ad Efficiency Analysis
descriptions: ‚Ä¢ CPC (Cost Per Click): Average cost per click
‚Ä¢ CPM (Cost Per Mile): Cost per thousand impressions
‚Ä¢ CTR (Click Through Rate): Ratio of clicks to impressions

conversion.title: Conversion Analysis
descriptions: ‚Ä¢ CVR (Conversion Rate): Visitor to conversion ratio
‚Ä¢ CPA (Cost Per Action): Cost per conversion

qualityExplanation.heading: Detailed Explanation of Quality Settings
qualityExplanation.description: The quality setting only applies when the output format is JPEG or WebP (lossy compression mode). The lower the value, the smaller the file size, but the image quality may be degraded.
qualityExplanation.pngWarning: PNG is a lossless compression format, so the output quality is always maintained at 100%. Therefore, PNG ‚Üí PNG conversion does not affect the quality.
qualityExplanation.jpegWarning1: JPEG is a lossy compression format, so image quality may degrade as the quality value decreases. but
qualityExplanation.jpegWarning2: setting the quality to 100% will also apply lossless compression to JPEG
qualityExplanation.webpWarning1: WebP is a format that supports both lossy and lossless compression.
qualityExplanation.webpWarning2: Setting the quality to 100% also applies lossless compression to WebP,
qualityExplanation.webpWarning3: which maintains image quality, but can increase file size.
qualityExplanation.pngNote: When converting to PNG, the transparent areas of the original image are preserved.
qualityExplanation.otherNote: When converting to JPEG or WebP, the transparent areas of the original image are filled with white.

pngToPng.description: PNG is lossless compression, so the quality setting is not applied. The output PNG has the same quality as the original PNG.

pngToJpeg.description: Since this is a PNG (lossless) ‚Üí JPEG (lossy) conversion, the quality setting value is applied. The lower the value, the smaller the file size, but the image quality is degraded. When the quality is set to 100%, it is not JPEG lossless compression, but it maintains the best possible quality.

pngToWebp.description: Since this is a PNG (lossless) ‚Üí WebP (lossy/lossless) conversion, the quality setting value is applied. Lossless compression is applied when set to 100%, and lossy compression is applied when set to less than 100%. In the case of lossy compression, the lower the value, the smaller the file size, but the image quality is degraded.

jpegToPng.description: This is a JPEG (lossy) ‚Üí PNG (lossless) conversion. Since PNG is lossless compression, the quality setting is not applied. The output PNG looks visually identical to the original JPEG, but the loss already incurred in JPEG is not recovered.

jpegToJpeg.description: Since this is a JPEG (lossy) ‚Üí JPEG (lossy) conversion, the quality setting value is applied. The lower the value, the smaller the file size, but the image quality is further degraded.

jpegToWebp.description: Since this is a JPEG (lossy) ‚Üí WebP (lossy/lossless) conversion, the quality setting value is applied. Lossless compression is applied when set to 100%, and lossy compression is applied when set to less than 100%. In the case of lossy compression, the lower the value, the smaller the file size, but the image quality is degraded.

webpToPng.description: This is a WebP (lossy/lossless) ‚Üí PNG (lossless) conversion. Since PNG is lossless compression, the quality setting is not applied. The output PNG looks visually identical to the original WebP, but if the original WebP was lossy compressed, that loss is not recovered.

webpToJpeg.description: Since this is a WebP (lossy/lossless) ‚Üí JPEG (lossy) conversion, the quality setting value is applied. The lower the value, the smaller the file size, but the image quality is degraded. When the quality is set to 100%, it is not JPEG lossless compression, but it maintains the best possible quality.

webpToWebp.description: Since this is a WebP (lossy/lossless) ‚Üí WebP (lossy/lossless) conversion, the quality setting value is applied. Lossless compression is applied when set to 100%, and lossy compression is applied when set to less than 100%. In the case of lossy compression, the lower the value, the smaller the file size, but the image quality is degraded.

head.title: Privacy Policy - Marketing Tools
head.description: This is the privacy policy page for Marketing Tool Box.

privacyPolicyPage.title: Privacy Policy
privacyPolicyPage.intro: Marketing Tools (hereinafter referred to as the 'Site') respects the privacy of users and has the following policy to comply with relevant laws and regulations.

section1.title: 1. Information Collected
section1.content1: The site provides services free of charge without separate membership registration, and collects only minimal information:
section1.item1: Automatically collected information: visit history, IP address
section1.item2: Site usage statistics through Google Analytics
section1.item3: Cookie information to provide advertising services

section2.title: 2. Purpose of Collection
section2.item1: Understanding site usage status and improving service

section3.title: 3. Use of Cookies
section3.content: This site uses cookies to provide Google Analytics and advertising services. You can refuse the use of cookies in your browser settings, but in this case, the use of some services may be restricted.

section4.title: 4. Information Security
section4.content: The site takes the following basic security measures to protect users' personal information:
section4.item2: Limiting the collection of data containing personal information

section5.title: 5. Contact
section5.content: If you have any questions about the Privacy Policy, please contact us by email:

section6.title: 6. Changes to Privacy Policy
section6.content: This Privacy Policy is effective from December 1, 2024, and any changes will be notified through the site.

head.title: Terms of Service - Marketing Tools
head.description: This is the terms of service page for Marketing Tool Box.

termsOfServicePage.title: Terms of Service
termsOfServicePage.intro: These terms and conditions govern your use of the services provided by Marketing Tools (hereinafter referred to as the 'Site').

section1.title: 1. Purpose
section1.content: The purpose of these terms is to define the terms and procedures for using all services provided by the site, as well as the rights, obligations, and responsibilities of users and the site.

section2.title: 2. Use of Service
section2.item1: The site provides services free of charge without separate membership registration.
section2.item2: Services are provided through a web browser, and some functions may be limited depending on the browser type and version.
section2.item3: The site may change the service contents without prior notice to improve the service.

section3.title: 3. User's Obligations
section3.item1: Users must comply with relevant laws and regulations and the provisions of these terms when using the service.
section3.item2: Users may not reproduce or distribute information obtained through the service without permission.
section3.item3: Users must not engage in any act that interferes with the stable operation of the service.

section4.title: 4. Disclaimer
section4.item1: The site is not responsible for any damages arising from the use of the free services provided.
section4.item2: The site is not responsible for service interruption due to natural disasters, technical defects, etc.
section4.item3: Users are responsible for the use of the results generated through the tools provided by the site.

section5.title: 5. Copyright
section5.content: The copyright for all services, information, and designs provided by the site belongs to the site. Users may use the services for non-commercial purposes, but may not use them commercially without the consent of the site.

section6.title: 6. Changes to Terms
section6.content: The site may change the terms if necessary, and the changed terms will be announced through the site. Users who do not agree to the changed terms may stop using the service.

section7.title: 7. Dispute Resolution
section7.content: Disputes arising from the use of the service shall be handled in accordance with relevant laws and regulations, and in the event of a dispute, both parties shall make efforts to resolve the dispute through mutual consultation.
